list_definition.definition: a sweet frozen dessert made from fruit juice, sugar, and water

list_ex_of_english: He then buys her an iced sorbet and gives her his handkerchief with some money in it.
It is a shelf-stable frozen dessert which has to be shaken, and if left overnight in the freezer, can be eaten as a sorbet.
These examples were individually made, and specially designed for making the then popular citrus drink "sorbet".
No portion of the meal is spared from experimentation; tomato sorbet finds its way into the salad, while the consomm soup features melon pieces.
Haato primarily sells gelato, yoghurt, sorbet, waffles, pastries, beverages and hot food.
Sorbet is a frozen treat made from fruit, syrup and ice.
It allows a service fee at the table: fruits, drinks, sorbets, and ice decorative figurines.
